Authors:
Milan C. Samarakoon, Jian-Kui Liu, Kevin D Hyde,
ITTHAYAKORN PROMPUTTHA
Title:
Two new species of Amphisphaeria (Amphisphaeriaceae) from
northern Thailand
Keywords:
2 new taxa, Amphisphaeriales, phylogeny, taxonomy, woody
branches
Abstract:
Amphisphaeria flava sp. nov., and A. thailandica sp. nov.,
collected from dead woody branches in northern Thailand are described
and illustrated in this study. Both taxa share brown outer peridium and
1-septate brown ascospores in uniserriate asci. Amphisphaeria flava is
characterized by ostiole surrounding pale yellow host surface and
comparatively thin peridium and ascopores. Amphisphaeria thailandica is
characterized by ellipsoid to oval ascospores. Maximum parsimony,
Maximum likelihood and Bayesian inference analyses of a combined ITS and
LSU DNA sequence data show that A. flava and A. thailandica are distinct
from other Amphispheria species in family Amphisphaeriaceae.
